website_summaries.verdict: This cooler can tow behind your boat or canoe and keep a decent amount of food and drinks cool.
pros: Shaped like a mini kayak to make it easier to travel in the water
Doesn't pop like an inflatable floating cooler
cons: Though this cooler is designed to tow behind, it does not have a designated hole for a rope
A rope must be attached to one of the handles

customer_reviews.title: Don’t tie it like you see in the pics unless you love work.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this cooler used it for dry storage for a three day kayak trip work perfectly it’s one flaw do not tie it like you see in the pictures and less you just want to cause a ton of drag on your boat. You want this thing kissing your tail end the whole time for easy cruising. Yes now it can’t float up next to you but I wanna meet the guy/girl that can open this while sitting in there boat get stuff out then twist this lid back on. That’s why I give it four stars. I will upload pics later of how I tied it to my kayak for the best results.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Thayer

customer_reviews.title: This thing is FANTASTIC. I do wish it had a dedicated hole ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is FANTASTIC. I do wish it had a dedicated hole to attach a rope to it, instead of having to attach to the handle. But its not a big deal. I have yet to use it in very hot temperatures, but it worked great in 60's-70's and the ice lasted for the entire three day trip. It floats very well even when its fully stocked. You will feel it slightly when pulling behind your canoe or kayak. but if you tie it close it will prevent it from swinging around too much behind you.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Hmmmm
customer_reviews.text: Update on this cool little cooler it's like dragging around an anchor makes you paddle so slow gets you tired and dosent tow behind you well enough to even be close to efficient used it twice dont think I will ever use it again
customer_reviews.author: white buffalo

customer_reviews.title: This is perfect for the Yakker
customer_reviews.text: WOW!! This is perfect for the Yakker!! I was skeptical about it but after I got it, I camo'ed it to match my kayak attached a circulating air pump bubbler ran a hose through the cup holder and its a perfect floating live well for fish.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Withrow

customer_reviews.title: Water tight through minor "rapids"! Will get much use from our family.
customer_reviews.text: Used this while floating the Comal River in New Braunfels, TX. Worked flawlessly, keeping our snacks dry even after opening multiple times while on the river! Love it, and several of our party, after seeing it in use, are going to purchase their own now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stays dry and holds it all
customer_reviews.text: Paid $120 for this little floater and worth every penny. Water tight, stable and very well made. I will use it for multiple uses including a live well for my catch. Tried to sink it in my bath tub...impossible. I am thinking of putting a mini skeg on it to keep it tracking directly behind my Kayak. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Paulsbud

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: This cooler was a big hit. Spacious and easy to carry. We suggest tethering it a little farther away from your kayak as opposed to right up to it- less banking against the kayak when you turn.
customer_reviews.author: Stacie Wanamaker

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product, however, it's getting a 4-star rating because there is quite a bit of drag while hauling behind kayaks. The level of drag is dependent on how much is packed in the cooler, of course. I wish that it had a drain plug as well. Tipping the cooler over to let water out (while there's still stuff in it) is more of a chore than it needs to be. Other than those two things this is a really good product
customer_reviews.author: Chris H

customer_reviews.title: Keeps items cold and pulled behind a kayak just fine
customer_reviews.text: I put a Kayak Skeg Tracking Fin Kayak Fin on the bottom with some marine grade glue and filled it with some dry ice, 1.5 bags of ice and a bunch of food and beverages and went 3.5 miles up Lake Chelan. Kept the cooler in the water the entire time - next to the shore with a rope tied to a old tree and the cooler kept everything cold for all three days. Or shall I say some items were a little frozen after 3 days in 100 degree heat no less. The fin helped with tracking and no problems pulling the cooler. Lots of compliments too. A good buy.
customer_reviews.author: John Thoennes

customer_reviews.title: Decent so far.
customer_reviews.text: Took on test float and it floats. Not easy to set up to tow behind kayak. Not really wanting to tow by rope handles. Took one handle off and attached to snap links and made new handle along with 24 inch left and right tow lines to help track behind my kayak. Do not recommend any longer. I would even recommend 16 to 18 inch tow lines. The cover is easy to use, stayed sealed. Not sure on how long I've will stay, will run wet test later, but it looks to be comparable to a decent cooler that can keep ice for 24 to 48 hours, but will see.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Lid is very hard to secure
customer_reviews.text: I’m really disappointed with this cooler. The lid is extremely hard to secure just right until it clicks. In fact I still have not been able to do it regularly. My husband finally figured out the trick thankfully otherwise we would not have been able to use it at all. But he still finds it difficult. It takes him several tries to lock it closed. Also, do not tow this behind a boat or jet ski. We did and we’re only going about 10 mph and the lid came off. Now we just tie it way up on the jetski. (Yes the lid was secured with the ‘click’).
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for my cat..
customer_reviews.text: My cat floats in it, while I am swimming in my pool. :)
customer_reviews.author: Cucco

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This is such an awesome cooler! We pull it behind our kayak and fill it with either drinks, ice, and snacks, or we start out with it empty and fill it with fish we've caught. Or both. A little fish in the beer never hurt anybody. The cooler floats really well and handles waves and rapids better than our full size kayaks. It's also very streamlined so it doesn't create a lot of drag, as long as it's filled evenly front to back.
customer_reviews.author: Cha Loo

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: Thicker plastic than I expected. Very sturdy, built to hold up in the wilderness. The entire inside is open for storage and it's insulated between the plastic layers. Really cool pool or beach cooler. I have a ultra light 10' viper kayak and the creek cooler feels as thick or thicker than the kayak in places. It's not cheap but you get your money's worth for sure, highly recommend as a high end multi purpose cooler or floating storage
customer_reviews.author: Otto

customer_reviews.title: Hauls a lot - easy to tow.
customer_reviews.text: Works well - this is the second one we now own. Use behind our kayaks on outings on our lake, on river tube trips and kayaking in Florida on the intercoastal waterway. Keeps things cold for hours and hours. The only downside is that the top is kinda hard to secure on. But once you know how to do it its not bad. Highly recommend it. People always stop and ask us where we got it.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Great product, didn’t hold ice long!
customer_reviews.text: Great product, didn’t hold ice as well as I would have thought. Used it on a 30 mile, 3 day kayak trip. It was 90+ degrees all weekend though so I was expecting the ice to melt some but not as much as it did. Also, the lid can be difficult to thread correctly but once properly sealed it did keep the river water out. When I paddled too fast it would become a little bit of a submarine and go under the water. I knew it would be noticeable towing it definitely not as bad as pulling another boat even when it was full to the top.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Inconvenient to drain
customer_reviews.text: We love this. We call it the banana cooler. The first time we used it we had two large bags of ice probably 14 bottles of tea and Snapple. Sandwich meat,fruit and a container of mayo. The only design flaw is that there isn't a drain spout. You have to turn it upside down to empty it.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie H.

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this cooler, read a lot of reviews before purchase!! I tow it behind my kayak, can't even tell it's there!! I read where lid was a little difficult to get on, so I took some Vaseline and lubed the o-ring!! I'm very happy with it and would highly recommend it!!
customer_reviews.author: Steve T

customer_reviews.title: Really waterproof.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to take with us on the Guadalupe or Comal rivers in Texas when we go tubing. Have taken this thing through rapids and turned it completely over, but the lid held & we didn't loose a thing! (Have tried lots of coolers & they work well until something happens and they turn upside down. Then you loose all your contents. Not the Creekcooler.)
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Fanning

customer_reviews.title: I’m torn
customer_reviews.text: Initial thoughts. PROS-Very sturdy construction. CONS-Would rather no beverage holders. Lid is very difficult to secure. Should have used same thread as an Igloo 5 gallon beverage cooler. No flag. Haven’t used it yet. Will update on ice retention/ longevity. By the way, it is BIG.
customer_reviews.author: TMBarbier

customer_reviews.title: Nice design..... BUT
customer_reviews.text: Great consept, but it takes two hands to open and close the lid. Hard to do when you floating in the water and your holding your drink. The ICE will only last about 6 hours when the water temp is 85 degs and the air temp is 105 degs outside. I live in AZ and we use it for an ice chest floating in the lake.
customer_reviews.author: Rob C

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: This thing was perfect for our first trip. Only qualm is it doesn’t have a drain plug and turning it upside down doesn’t get all the water out. Gotta let it air out for a few days. It’s a lot cheaper than the yeti cooler I was considering for the back of my kayak. Those suckers are 300$!
customer_reviews.author: andrea wolfe

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!
customer_reviews.text: Lobstering and spear fishing in California. I think the price is reasonable, Worth it I had no manufacturing issues. This is a well made product easy to carry around . I would like to see an “anchor point “, line attachment for towing behind. But the rope handle is durable and works fine to.
customer_reviews.author: jkiller

customer_reviews.title: Nice look
customer_reviews.text: I Love the looks of this the only thing it don't hold ice long but thats ok that means we have to drink a little faster lol. Overall a very nice flows behind the kayak like a charm got all my friends getting one so get ready to shift out a few more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love our baby yak
customer_reviews.text: I call this piece ‘the baby yak’ we needed something for gathering fish in when checking jugs or trot lines with the kayak and found this. We fill it with some water and attach a rope to the main kayak and it follows along. Very sturdy and easy to maneuver.
customer_reviews.author: Tonya

customer_reviews.title: Make your friends jealous
customer_reviews.text: Take this baby for a spin behind your kayak. Watch the dudes break their necks in awe at the capacity of beer you brought while keeping the remaining space inside your kayak free for activities. Girl needs a beer, you got plenty o' beer while their boyfriends ran out...looks like you're their favorite person now. Leave your kids with granny cause this cooler just ain't as cool when you're pulling out juice boxes. I suggest putting some badass stickers on it, like a World War planes shark-face art. Meat & Potatoes: Chicks dig it, awesome capacity, can't even tell you're towing it, and BEER.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Harris

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Durable with plenty of capacity - perfect for a long float down the river
customer_reviews.author: Barkley

customer_reviews.title: Good concept and eliminates the hassle of putting to much into your kayak. Short temp hold
customer_reviews.text: It definitely as large as they say, and holds what they claim. But, I will not hold temp for as long as they claim. My first test for this cooler was a cloudy/rainy 85 degree day on the lake and my ice was gone in just under 12 hours. Also when loaded it doesn’t track very well behind my 12ft field and stream
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: I used it to keep drinks cool, and dried food dry without ice on an ...
customer_reviews.text: The Creel Kooler is everything I expected. I used it to keep drinks cool, and dried food dry without ice on an Alaskan fall hunting float, by towing it behind my raft on a 3 day river float. I never opened the cooler in the water and it was never submerged, however it did manage to pick up about a pint of water. Not convinced the seam is absolutely water tight. I rated it 4 stars. I would recommend the cooler to friends.
customer_reviews.author: John Humphries

customer_reviews.title: Multifunctional worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny. Love this little baby. Keeps drinks cool. Multifunctional...acts as a life saving device and also a shower caddy holding all shower essentials in the middle of the lake.
customer_reviews.author: daiz

customer_reviews.title: She loves it!
customer_reviews.text: this was a gift for my daughter-in-law. She was bouncing up and down when she got the box opened. She has had it out on the river a couple times, and loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Clark

customer_reviews.title: Tows very easily,  glad I bought it!
customer_reviews.text: Really enjoyed this cooler I purchased for our 16 mile kayak trip on the Colorado River. It towed behind very well, I even forgot I had it for most of the trip. Really glad I had it. Looks like this will last for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: rachel tallon

customer_reviews.title: Worked well. Kept ice all day
customer_reviews.text: It floats well. Probably would do better with a cleat up front instead of tying to a rope. The led is a bit cumbersome but once you get used to it not bad
customer_reviews.author: Ryan S Reese

customer_reviews.title: Amazing cooler!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband and he loves it! It's large and heavy but floats great! It really holds the ice well and keeps cold for several days. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Mlsaj84

customer_reviews.title: Pretty cool and cheap too!
customer_reviews.text: Got this to use as a dry/ice storage for excursions on the river and to the barrier islands. Haven’t used it yet but is very sturdy and almost matches my kayak too with the yellow! Will update later after taking it out seeing how it pulls and ice retention with pre-chill.
customer_reviews.author: william cress

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: Ice cooler for wade fishing, modified it for a live well for larger bait, Sturdy and well made.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: When the cooler is in tow, keep the line as short as possible.
customer_reviews.text: The creek cooler floats well and keeps everything cool: holds 20# of ice and ~30 cold drinks with some room for snacks. This is a three-star review because the lid is awkward and doesn't line up easily when your out on the water. Creek Kooler should consider a light colored rubber/polymer lid as an option/upgrade to make access easier: while you're floating your action vs. the coolers' reaction [while floating] is frustrating to say the least...
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: So cold!
customer_reviews.text: We have used this cooler twice so far and it works GREAT! We can be out on the lake all day and it keeps food/drinks very cold. So happy I bought this!
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Buy one you'll love it
customer_reviews.text: Love it, it's my favorite cooler and keeps I've a really long time
customer_reviews.author: James Bromley

customer_reviews.title: Improve the lid
customer_reviews.text: Lid is not as easy to put on as advertised. A simple design change could fix it completely and make it 5 stars. You have to have the lid in a perfect position to install and it take several tries
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Good

customer_reviews.title: Good Cooler
customer_reviews.text: This is a great kayak cooler. It’s large, but I read reviews that the smaller one didn’t hold very much. It will be great for full day floats.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: I order this CreekCooler to ice down fish while saltwater ...
customer_reviews.text: I order this CreekCooler to ice down fish while saltwater fishing. It is well built and solid. Haven't used it yet, but I will update my review after I see how well it performs.
customer_reviews.author: Elton W.

customer_reviews.title: ... river tubing a couple weeks ago and it did great. It was much easier than renting another tube ...
customer_reviews.text: Took my CreekKooler river tubing a couple weeks ago and it did great. It was much easier than renting another tube and putting a bulky cooler in it. A couple of my friends actually bought the same one after our trip.
customer_reviews.author: Quinning

customer_reviews.title: Too expensive
customer_reviews.text: Love it wish I had 30 of them could have sold them on the river everyone wanted to know where I got it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So big!
customer_reviews.text: Great size, perfect for pulling behind a kayaking. Very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Komar

customer_reviews.title: Needs a little improvement
customer_reviews.text: Good overall. The foam handles are awful though. I wish the company would supply something less big, as the knots untie easily and you can lose it on the water.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Michael Flanagan

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: Very good cooler however it doesn’t track behind my kayak well at all. I would have been better off buy a $30 igloo and pulled it. Not impressed. Felt like I was pulling a 55 gallon drum.
customer_reviews.author: sealesa

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a Float Trip
customer_reviews.text: This CreekKooler is absolutely perfect for float trips. We went on a 9 mile kayak trip, 8 hours, and there was still ice left in the cooler by the time we got done. There was little to no drag pulling the thing behind our kayaks as well. Highly recommend if you go on a lot of river trips.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cooler
customer_reviews.text: First one was destroyed by the delivery company so amazon sent another one and was perfect. Works great floating the river.
customer_reviews.author: Mobes

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler!
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm towing behind tube or kayak on river. Plenty of ice left next day after a full day and half in the sun. Tether strap on lid is a great idea! Wish it had a drain plug! Easy enough to tilt to drain excess ice-water so not a deal breaker.
customer_reviews.author: Traci B.

customer_reviews.title: It does keep your drinks cold. Vary light to ...
customer_reviews.text: It does keep your drinks cold. Vary light to handle, and store, however use extream caution, when out on creeks and rivers, it likes to get hugn up on debris, and doesn't flow in line with your kayak. I even shortened the lanyard to make it safer. I'm not sure if I would order another one.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Hisel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Love this! Actually bought two, one for husband one for son that goes to college next year. First week they had, put it in the pool! Perfect for pulling behind kayak, drinks in the pool and tying up to boat while hanging out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you're questioning it buy it... thrust me
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome cooler... I attach it to my kayak and cant even feel it's there no drag at all. Also could be used as a great dry box as well
customer_reviews.author: ben suber

customer_reviews.title: Nice cooler
customer_reviews.text: No drag when paddling, we had 2 on our Wisconsin River Trip. The cold cooler kept ice for 48 hours. Used the other one for dry storage. Definetly worth buying!
customer_reviews.author: jacqueline yech

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Such a cool product. Great for long kayak rides or just sitting at the pool
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does well
customer_reviews.text: This cooler tracks decent behind a kayak, I use paracord and a couple carabiners to hook it on. It does cause a little drag though. It holds ice well for day trips. Spent about 8 hours on the water and still had ice at the end in 100 degree weather. It holds a good amount of drinks and ice. It’s well worth the money spent.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Chambless

customer_reviews.title: Lake life
customer_reviews.text: I've had it on the lake and full of drinks to last all day and some....great buy
customer_reviews.author: Rocky

customer_reviews.title: Love my floating bar!
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase ever! Keeps drinks cold and tracks great behind my kayak!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Amador

customer_reviews.title: FUN
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS FABULOUS! WE USE IT IN THE POOL, WHEN WE ARE OUT ON THE BOAT-- VERY USEFUL
customer_reviews.author: Lori Lyon

customer_reviews.title: Kept our drinks cold all day in the Texas heat ...
customer_reviews.text: Kept our drinks cold all day in the Texas heat! Stayed with us as we floated the Frio and we had no ptoblem putring the lid back on. Well worth what I paid.
customer_reviews.author: A V

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great river cooler!! Lasted all day in the hot summer
customer_reviews.author: WDLN

customer_reviews.title: Very durable holds ice long time
customer_reviews.text: Wow keeps ice for hrs does pull a little rough but you get use to it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: My family love this cooler! It is awesome! They no longer have to take several mini coolers on the water!
customer_reviews.author: Lightning Remodeling

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Floating cooler!!
customer_reviews.text: This cooler is great for hanging out at the sand bar at the lakes and following me along while in my Kayak!! 13 hours on lake and still had plenty of ice!!
customer_reviews.author: Arson818

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product, works awesome
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product, works awesome. Only complaint is it is a little awkward to screw the lid on correctly especially when you are in a kayak on the side of it. But other than that i am totally happy with it
customer_reviews.author: justin

customer_reviews.title: 40 beers no problem
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny! I put over 40 beers in this and it kept them cold on the river no problem. If you float the river, you need this in your life.
customer_reviews.author: matthew overall

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Holds perfect amount for a day of river floating. Gave as a gift & recipient lived it
customer_reviews.author: jamie lynette middleton

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I love it. Very roomy, holds a ot. Cover can be difficult to put back on when in the water. Definitely need very short tow line otherwise it is all over the river. It is just great and I am glad I got it.
customer_reviews.author: Denny610

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Named her Kayak Kate. She does great with holding drinks. One thing we notice is like everyone else, the lid is sometimes hard to get lined up to twist on correctly. Other than that, we love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: MN Vikings ~ SKOL

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bigger than expected and better quality than I expected! What a great idea and what a great product!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lid fills with water if it flips
customer_reviews.text: Went floating and flipped the lid filled with water and wont drain
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best float cooler
customer_reviews.text: Well insulated. Easy to carry. Holds plenty of drinks. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: John G Stoner

customer_reviews.title: love this!!!!
customer_reviews.text: love this..holds so much gear.stays dry.gives me so much more room in my kayak to relax.light weight.fits in my trunk.everyone that sees it wants one..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Convenient river cooler
customer_reviews.text: This cooler is great in that it cannot be turned upside down and it will float. We lash it to our tube and it trails along nicely. The plastic is rugged and takes abuse from rock, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Shilo Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I wish the top was a flip and lock type
customer_reviews.author: Shechonia

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic cooler!
customer_reviews.text: Works really well, and gets lots of comments/attention on the creeks.
customer_reviews.author: D. Mattke

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Alot of room but does not hold ice very well, melted quite quickly
customer_reviews.author: Tracy S

customer_reviews.title: Works with my kayak
customer_reviews.text: I think it's pricey for a cooler but I am happy I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel T.

customer_reviews.title: A take way off my kayak cooler wise
customer_reviews.text: It is nice I had not use the cooler yet on the river it's pretty cool
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought it !
customer_reviews.text: It holds a lot and keeps ice real good. I did find out u need to tight it as close as u can to ur kayak. That way it won't get up beside u and turn u around. I use it every time we go out.
customer_reviews.author: Kelley Cawthon

customer_reviews.title: Doubles as a submarine for the baby.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. If I didn’t need to store my water and beer, I’d use it as a submarine for the baby.
customer_reviews.author: KevinGarrity

customer_reviews.title: Kept everything very cold!
customer_reviews.text: Have to keep a short rope on the tow! If you let it get to long the nose dips in the water. Other than that functioned as a cooler perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Reneta E

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: Held a good amount of drinks and ice but keep in mind the heavier the looker the more drag you have towing. Had a head wind for a 4 mile Kayak trip and got quite the workout!
customer_reviews.author: jay huerta

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for water activities
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used this item yet, but is exactly what I needed for dry storage on long kayak trips. Came as described, well built, adequate size.
customer_reviews.author: Jarmijo

customer_reviews.title: Great for day to two day float trips
customer_reviews.text: Very convenient to have extra space for food & drinks! Friends can pull right up to grab a cold one. Worked great on my recent two day kayak trip.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A lot bigger than it looks
customer_reviews.text: The cooler is perfect. Used it for tubing the river. It stayed upright, handled rapids without issue, and is really spacious.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect on float trips behind my kayak. Holds ice for at least two days
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Only used it once so far but Worked perfectly!!! Ice stay good for hours.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hard to tow
customer_reviews.text: Built well but it doesn’t tow very well behind the kayak.
customer_reviews.author: Kentech80

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This product is not worth the money. The lid does not stay on and ice lasted maybe a few hours.
customer_reviews.author: Paulette Shatara

customer_reviews.title: Holds 30 pack with about 15lbs of ice
customer_reviews.text: Bought it, used it, loved it. Much easier to tow than an inflatable cooler. But yeah, lid sucks to close while floating.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great and a wonderful gift for those that kayak!
customer_reviews.author: Karen Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Lake fun
customer_reviews.text: This will be a great addition to our family water fun. It's going to get lots of use when the weather warms up.
customer_reviews.author: john martin

customer_reviews.title: Saves a ton of room in your kayak
customer_reviews.text: Seems very well made. 30 qt is very roomy. Also can double for dry storage.
customer_reviews.author: Annette Shearer

customer_reviews.title: Tows great
customer_reviews.text: We used this cooler many times this summer tubing down the river. it floats behind you and you barely know it is there.
customer_reviews.author: James S.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best way to keep cold drinks while floating. So glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: It’s an over priced item but works as in dictated
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Worth it, great buy
customer_reviews.text: I mostly use it for dry storage, works great can barely tell it's back there, easy to access while on the water with right tow length
customer_reviews.author: steven

customer_reviews.title: Floats, keeps cold, and easy to tow.
customer_reviews.text: Does what it's supposed to but expensive for what it is.
customer_reviews.author: Eric H

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this thing, I've used it to keep stuff dry and as a cooler. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: CreekKooler Floating Cooler, Tow on Rivers and Lakes with Canoe or Kayak, 30 Quart
product_meta.description: CreekKooler custom, hydro-dipped Koolers are the perfect additional to the avid water-fowlers arsenal. The camo CreekKooler is the only insulated, floating Kooker that can easily tow behind your kayak, canoe, boat, or pirogue. Clip them onto your waders belt loop when tromping through the march or timber.
feature_bullets: FLOATING COOLER - Save space in your small watercraft and tow the CreekKooler.
INSULATED DESIGN - Two inches of insulation is injected into the hull and deck, giving CreekKooler an ice retention of 48 hours. 30 quart capacity holds (30) 12-oz cans and 20lbs of ice.
TOWABLE - Tow the CreekKooler behind small watercrafts, float in the water or drag across dry ground.
DRY STORAGE - With its watertight, locking lid and o-ring design, use your CreekKooler as secure storage on the water or in the snow.
PATENTED DESIGN - Dual-wall, blow molded construction, 4 drink holders located on deck.
